caption: One of my favorite pizza places. I love the crust on the thin crust and the toppings are quality!
Gluten free deep dish was amazing

We made it here on a Saturday night shortly before closing time and were somehow led straight to a table. The best pizza I've ever had, hands down. Our server is great! We tried to come back on Sunday night around dinner time, but the wait was over an hour and my wife just couldn't wait anymore in the cold. We'll certainly be coming back.

I ordered some pizza and pasta to go, and I was pleasantly surprised at how quickly it arrived. The service was great, and I'm thankful because I just had to wait a short time for my order. It was all worth it because the pizza and pasta were delicious, and my mother enjoyed them as well. Thank you, gentlemen! Keep up the good work!
Great food

This is the most beautiful spot I've ever seen! The pizza was incredible; it was the best I'd ever had. The service was outstanding because the workers were very receptive to our requests. The tables are wide and the seats are comfortable; prams and wheelchairs are also welcome. Simply try to pay a visit to the venue!

The best pasta restaurant in town! I love the Bolognese here, and they serve pizza, too. They've got the most helpful employees and servers. Their pastaio was also really funny and bubbly! It was a very relaxing and cozy spot. The next time I come here, I'm going to bring my family here, sure they're going to love their pasta!
Best and only Gluten Free Chicago Deep Dish Pizza!
Best Pizza Around!!

After speaking with a co-worker with gluten sensitivity, I had longed to visit Chicago Pizza to see if their gluten free pizza was as good as I was told. Alas, it was not. The crust on the deep-dish was rock hard. After trying a number of places as well as making attempts on my own, I'm afraid that it's time to say goodbye to pizza all together.
Great pizza and good prices.
If you want to experience Chicago this is the place to go. And not too expensive either! Honestly a MUST DO for anyone travelling Chicago!
We read great reviews about this place, and we totally agree! The pizza was to die for. My daughter orders this wherever we go, and this was the best ever.

We had to try this pizza here and the dough is amazing. Everything was so tasty about our pizza. Terrific pie. Recipes of imagination.

Have been going here for 5+ years - usually takeout, but have also dined in a few times. They have great deep dish and delicious wings! The gluten free version of the deep dish is good too, and that’s tough to find. All around, highly recommend.

I love this place. They have very delicious pizza. During pandemic i can’t go to restaurant but i deliver a lot. Delivery always on time. They have twin brothers delivery drivers. They are so friendly and on time always. Thanks for your service Chicago’s Pizza👍

My friends and I had our lunch here today. We had their Pepperoni and it was tasty and the best we've ever had! The crust was very crunchy and not oily. We also had their chipotle chicken and it was delicious! They also had pies, too. We will try them for our next visit. I highly recommend this pizza parlor!

This is the only place I can get a pizza exactly the way I want. They also have a very consistent quality and I know I will get what I want every time I order. The delivery is so fast and when it arrived, the pizza is still hot. I liked the service so much as well as the very accommodating staff.
This is where you want to go for an authentic Chicago pizza
Pizza was amazing! Greet staff and good location!

(Translated by Google) A place. Very cozy where you can enjoy an excellent pizza and also very good service.  (Original) Un lugar. Muy acogedor  donde puedes disfrutar de una excelente pizza y además muy buena  atención.

Food was awesome, we got pasta and a sandwich, both were hot on arrival. They kept the salad outside the hot bag so it didn't get hot at all. Speedy service right to the door of our apartment. Will be looking their way again when we are the mood for some solid comfort food.

This was my first time back to Chicago in a while. I heard great things about this place and decided to give it a shot. I’m glad I stopped in. The deep dish pie was very good. Pair that with a cold beer and great music is a win win in my book. I would recommend this place to anyone looking for delicious food and a great atmosphere.

(Translated by Google) Very good pizzeria great variety of quite good ingredients without a doubt it has very good service this place is quite good the pizzas I quite like the restaurant, very good service the servers quite kind to us I quite liked the place, excellent service  (Original) Muy buena pizzeria gran variedad de ingredientes bastante buenos sin duda alguna tiene muy buen servicio este lugar esta bastante buenas las pizzas me agrado bastante el restaurante, muy buen servicio los meseros bastante amables con nosotros me gusto bastante el lugar, excelente servicio
Deep dish slices are always delicious.

First time visiting Chicago and I had to try the deep dish pizza.  I have a wheat allergy so I was so happy to have found a parlor that does a gluten free deep dish crust!  If the gluten free pizza is this good, I'm super jealous for those that can eat the regular crust.  Thank you Chicago's for a great togo online ordering and eating experience!
Wow! We had the gluten free deep dish pizza and it was INCREDIBLE! Staff were great! Would highly recommend if you’re on a GF diet.
Very clean,great help for out of town people. Good food
After i took the first bite of their pepperoni pizza I did a hoppy skippity dance in celebration!

Placed an order for a tasty ‘Za online. Credit card was charged. Confirmation texts sent to the phone. We’ve waited over 2 hours and finally called one of the other locations that told us they close at 10pm. The audacity! I’ve never felt more hoodwinked. Will NOT be ordering from this shady organization again. Will take my business elsewhere!!!
Great service and pizza!

Are you and your family/friends looking for a good Chicago style deep dish pizza, but someone is gluten intolerant? Look no further than Chicago's Pizza.  My boyfriend is very gluten sensitive and, while I actually like cauliflower crust pizza, sometimes I have a real craving for that carpet bomb of cheese and marinara called the Chicago deep dish. However, if we go to a pizza place that has a "gluten free pizza", what my boyfriend receives is almost always this sad little personal pizza that looks pathetic next to the heaping mass of calories and happiness that is my full size real deep dish.  This all changed when we discovered Chicago's Pizza.  I was almost skeptical when I saw that their gluten free deep dish comes in multiple sizes right alongside the regular pizza. On their website it states that they have been perfecting their gluten free crust for many years and that it tastes almost identical to their regular pies. We decided to put that to the test.  I ordered a large 14" pie for myself and a 14" pie for him and we went to go pick it up. This was during the height of the 2020 pandemic so we were not able to enjoy the restaurant itself, but it was very nicely decorated and the cashier was very polite.  When we got the pizzas home, I noticed that my boyfriends pizza was placed inside of a special green pizza box with "GLUTEN FREE" on the top. This turned out to be very necessary because the two pies looked and smelled absolutely identical. Heaps of cheese, crust and marinara.  After slicing into my own pie, my boyfriend offered me part of the crust from his and I can honestly say that there was absolutely no difference between the two. The gluten free crust was just as flaky and buttery as the regular.  Keep in mind that there is a slight up-charge for the gluten free crust, but it is well worth it for the downtrodden, anti-gluten person in your group to enjoy a classic Chicago deep dish with you and not feel marginalized.  We will definitely be returning many times to Chicago's Pizza whenever we need to scratch that typical Chicagoan itch for our city's unique pie.
Food was good not great bought a chicken parmesan sandwich and it wasn't what I was expecting. Got more sauce on the McDonald's version of the same sandwich. Next time I'll order extra sauce

We came all the way from michigan to try some deep dish gluten free pizza and they did not disappoint! The pizza was awesome, the staff was friendly, the wait time was short, and the atmosphere was great! Celiac friendly pizza for sure! We will be back!

Phenomenal pizza for a late night, post concert bite. Twiddle and Kitchen Dwellers worked up an appetite only a Chicago Supreme stuffed could handle. Friendly staff, clean restrooms, and delicious late night pies...what's not to love!

I am a regular customer as they are the only pizzeria that makes a true gluten free crust for all types of pizza. There delivery is usually average but tonight they are extremely well past their delivery window, well over an hour. Also they have shut down all their phones so no one can answer. This is ridiculous, I may not be a regular customer anymore  unless this is rectified.

I can’t believe this happened. I was in the process of purchasing the slice, Only for the cashier to lie and say they were magically out. Terrible restaurant and horrible staff

The gluten free deep dish is the best you can find. We drive from the suburbs for the crust and flavor you crave! Never disappointed. Just wish Chicago's Pizza would come out to the burbs. Go west, pizza man! Go west!

This place is great if you have Celiac disease!! The waiter asked if anyone was gluten free before I even sat down. Lots of amazing dishes you can order gluten free including garlic bread and deep dish pizza. They even brought out gluten free focaccia bread before the meal.

My wife and I were up from Virginia to attend the Bears vs Saints game. We discovered this gem of a place via Google at 2am Saturday night. I tell you what, the pizza .. incredible... this was the best food and best service I have ever received. We found Chicago’s when looking for gluten free restaurants in the area (I have celiac’s disease so I can’t eat gluten) and we picked this place because they had gluten free deep dish (a childhood dream being filled). When we went to the restaurant the waiter sat us down and asked if anyone was gluten free and promptly brought out gluten free garlic bread on the house (it was like eating garlic-y pillows of goodness). After a long internal debate I ordered a gluten free pepperoni deep dish. YALL THIS WAS SO GOOD. My mouth was watering, my heart was full of cheesy goodness, and I ate so much pizza that we had to walk home. My family said that the gluten free crust was just as good as the regular!  If I could give this restaurant 20 stars I would. Best service, best food, and I would travel from Texas back to Illinois for this pizza again.

We ordered online, it indicated that it would take an hour to be delivered.  That's a long wait, but that's alright, we decided to wait.  At an hour and a half we called and asked for the status of our pizza.  We were told it would be another 5 minutes.  We called back 20 minutes later wondering where our food was, and about that time the delivery guy finally showed up.  After going down to pick up our food (because they apparently don't deliver to the room), we get it back and the pizza hasn't been cut (there's an option when you order online to have it "not cut", we didn't select that though).  We've never had Chicago deep dish pizza and were excited to try it out... well we didn't have silverware either, so we literally tore this messy pizza and scooped up toppings with our hands.  All in all, the pizza was OK, but the service was kind of terrible.  1 hour 50 minute wait time, didn't even slice the pizza, no silverware.

Chicago's Pizza is the only pizzeria in Chicago, that I know of, that sells gluten-free stuffed pizza. It is absolutely delicious, to-die-for, heavenly pizza.  Lots of pizzerias now sell gluten free pizzas, but they are usually pre-made crusts and are flat... not a Chicago Pizza-type experience.  I am so pleased to have found Chicago's Pizza. Everytime I visit Chicago, or Chicago friend visits me, I am sure to purchase a gluten-free stuffed pizza from Chicago's Pizza.  FYI, they also can ship these pizzas to you!

The gentleman who was taking care of me even allowed me to leave my pizza there in the fridge so I wouldnt have to carry it with me through Lincoln Park Zoo! Such a great experience and quality food.

This is a must have stop for Chicago.  They have an extensive menu, and they can make gluten free on everything it seems.  Vesuvio potatoes appetizer was wonderful.  Very attentive and aware of gluten free. Deep dish pizza was wonderful with a  buttery crust.  They are obviously cooking all dishes and all can be adjusted.

Haven't had made from scratch gluten free pizza in ....um..never!!  Was so good, can't wait to go back. Loved that when we walked in the host immediately asked if anyone in our party would be eating GF...so brought out some GF bread for me to snack on!

Our annual trip to Chicago involves an annual trip to a different Chicago style pizza place…this year my wife’s sensibility wanting gluten free options won out which brought us to Chicago’s Pizza (The Lakeview location.) There are lots of gluten-free options including bread, calzones, pizza (of all depths) all made from their house-made gluten free-dough.  For gluten-full me I had two kinds of deep dish pizza to choose from…One is their stuffed crust (“what we’re famous for” our waiter said) which has an extra layer on the bottom with cheese in it. They also have a more traditional Chicago deep dish pizza and the crusts and sauces for both are different.  It was Memorial day Monday and we were the only people in the restaurant. They took good care of us.  I got their house extra crust/cheese pizza which very much looked like a traditional Chicago Deep Dish. The taste of the crust though wasn’t the classic buttery crust you’d get on the traditional deep dish…more like thick bread which isn’t usually what I’m going for on pizza of any kind. The sauce was super good though!  My wife thought the gluten-free was satisfying for what it was, though it had been so long since she had had a deep dish pizza that she couldn’t quite compare to the real thing. She did think the bottom of the crust in the middle was a little mushy but kudos to them for home making gluten-free dough and providing a legitimate experience to those with that diet, as opposed to so many restaurants that use frozen gluten-free dough.  The small pizzas, by the way, are actually quite large. It was way more than us little people could eat. (Especially getting 2, one gluten free and one regular.)  In the end I would have preferred the standard Deep Dish with the butter crust as that’s really what Chicago is all about whereas the stuffed crust is a little gimmicky and doesn’t offer anything special.
Every time I go to Chicago and I want pizza, I go here. The pizza is good, they have friendly staff, and the price is affordable. They make gluten free pizza, even deep dish (I think).

Again Chicago's Pizza is one of the best pizzas you can ever call and have their sauce is just amazing you have to get those mini burgers they are really good there their salads one of my favorites is a chef salad the anti pasta salad was also fantastic
Pizza here is a tad greasy but great taste. Open late for those midnight munchies too.

Pizzas were good. Bianca was my favorite of the bunch. However, lasagna of the day was even better. The best. Only downside: the waiting time even though we reserved, and the long waits between getting helped and the food served. But then again, it was dinner on Saturday.

Gluten free deep dish (and anything else)! This place really knows how to make a celiac feel safe. They have a dedicated area for gluten free pizzas and almost everything on the menu, including three styles of pizza can be gluten free. There are no commercially prepared crusts here, just perfect deep dish. Would come back here several times if I could.
Awesome food and gluten free options too

Amazing pizza! I am celiac and was able to have my first deep dish pizza. They brought gf bread to the table when we came in and it was hot, fluffy and delicious. Very helpful and well worth the trip.

Incredible gluten free deep dish pizza. We got one pie because I didn't want too much leftover but I loved it as much as my celiac wife did. Good prices too, normal for a Chicago pizza but only a couple of additional dollars for gf.  Serving staff was awesome too. She was both knowledgeable and fun.
Very friendly! Excellent pizza! The gluten free deep dish was wonderful.

Worst customer service I have ever encountered. I work in customer service and the way I was treated completely inappropriate. Ordered spaghetti and bread sticks. When I called asked if they delivered to hotel rooms. Was told yes. Delivery guy says no we don't. Keep in mind they had assess to get into the hotel and elevators.  So went down and got it. Got up to the room no cutlery. Called the next day due to the time to let them be aware. Was pretty much told I was in the wrong and the employee was imcredibly disrespectful.Your delivering to a hotel room.  I would think cutlery would be standard. Im not waiting 45 mins for a fork to eat cold spagetti. Dont tell me you delivery to rooms when you dont. Was told they would speak with the manager. NEVER HEARD BACK.
One of the best pizza places in Chicago. You may find excellent Gluten Free options, including amazing gorgeous pizza! Especially made for celiacs in a completely safe environment!
Best pizza place I visited in Chicago. I tried 4 places and this was the cheesiest :).
The GF pizza is so tasteful

Service suck they say one price on web and is different what they charge said 45min delivery..and I got it 1hr 12min.. cold pizza and cold wings.. than you call and they credit $5 really that's all I am late to punch for lunch hungry and not eating your food cause I don't have a way to heat it up so $30 gone to trash...

Yes, they have Gluten-free deep dish pizza, but that doesn't mean they use thick crust. They do it as thin crust, with high edges, as if done in a deep pan. Not what I expected, but still tasty. Nice staff. Clean atmosphere. Big selection of menu items.
GF DEEP DISH SOOOOO GOOD THANK YOU.
Its ok
This is the absolute best gluten-free pizza I've ever had. Amazing.
They started cutting their slices smaller and smaller and smaller whyyyy!!!  Ugh quit being stingy chicagos!
Gf deep dish is unheard of and it was stellar here. Pizza was off the chain. My wife is from NY and she loved it here.
Best Pizza crust in Chicago. They use Semolina Flour to make it. The only pizza that I eat whole crust.
Best of the bests
We had so much fun my family and I definitely coming back to this place we love the pizza
one of the best places to get slices.
Love the stuffed pizza. Always open and a great place to get traditional Chicago pizza!
How anyone couldnt love deep dish pizza is beyond me.  This place has great food, but not so great prices. But I will be back, and you should too
Love this pizza
Some of the best thin crust in Chicago, open late, by the slice, and punch card for a free sluce every 10.
Awesome pizza but costly!
Great food, huge menu and friendly staff
Don't get 🍕 by the slice here so I can have it all! Hahahaha
Fabulous gluten-free DEEP dish

We had a great time here! Fun time for kiddos - they get to make their own Mickey Mouse pizza (the 3 year old I was with LOVED this!) Plus, I had a very tasty gluten free pizza, which is hard to find!
If you are gluten free, you know the struggles of only getting 10" pizza when you order out. You can get any size here it is incredible.
Hee
Good price for good amount, love it.
So-so pizza, so-so atmosphere, decent prices.
Street parking, so paid parking. I ordered a thin crust pizza and it was good. It was ready on time, it was a pick order. You can dine in as well. The guy there was awesome

Gluten-free deep dish is unreal. Wish I could give them 5 stars more than once!  Update: finally dined in. Their grilled calamari is such a deal. So much food for such a great price. AND THEY HAVE GF BREAD AS A FREE STARTER SO I COULD SOP BREAD IN OLIVE OIL AS I WAITED FOR MY FOOD LIKE A NORMAL PERSON! THIS IS HUGE!  Also, "Death by Chocolate" cake....gluten free. I'll be back for you!  Oh, and service was great. They knew just what we needed and when and didn't hover. A++.

Absolutely amazing. I have Celiac and they showed a deep understanding of gluten allergies and took great care to prevent cross contamination. If you're gluten free and craving pizza - this is the absolute best choice.
The chicken wings are disgusting I think I got food poisoning from this place, later that night after eating from here I threw up everything I ate. Worst buffalo wings EVER!!!!!!!!
Not quite as good as advertised, but good
Great gluten free pizza, friendly staff.
Best gluten free pizza. The Chicago style is awesome
Awesome stuffed pizza. Open late, so perfect for after the bar close. Sandwiches are solid, too
Superb
Great service and amazing food. Huge gluten free menu. I loved the gluten free deep dish and gluten free garlic cheese bread was amazing. I will defiantly be going back next time I am in town!
(Translated by Google) Very good attention.  (Original) Muy buena atencion.
Amazing gluten free!
Nice place, friendly staff. Family's especially liked the extensive gluten free options. Couldn't come to Chicago without getting Chicago style pizza, and the GF options let the whole family enjoy.

Honestly I didn't expect the stuffed pizza to be as good as it was! Excellent quality and tons of cheese! We had pepperoni, mushroom and jalepeño. I would recommend not getting onions or green peppers on your pizza because it tends to make the pie soggy.
Great place.  Many gluten free choices including deep dish and chicago stuffed.  Less than 1 mile to Wrigley.
Good food freindly service. My daughter has celiac disease so finding this gluten free pizza place was awsome for her and the gluten free pizza was pretty darn good.
I'm gluten intolerant so I was glad to see such a great list of pizzas.  Had the thin and it was great.  Trying deep dish next time.
Great place to have a quick lunch or dinner. Pizzas by the slice and all of them are delicious. Definitely a good restaurant to have delicious food.
Great pizza and great gluten free pizza options.
Best pizza great service
Ordered a gluten free spinach pizza for my wife last night and was given the wrong pizza. Not gluten free and not the toppings I asked for. Not cool.
I believe one of the best Pizza's in Chicago!
Sausage and mushroom thin crust pizza. Tasted good. Staff polite & friendly.
Great deep dish. Wished I could have taken more home.
Friendly and curtious service of staff and wide range of delicious selection of foods!
They have pizza by the slice for handtossed (thin crust), deep dish, and stuffed. The handtossed is pretty good, a bit thicker than New York style. Very friendly staff and a nice atmosphere.
Love the food everything is good here not just the pizza
#BY FAR BEST PIZZA EVER
Service was great, pizza delicious,  had thick crust spinach.

One of my 3 favorite pizza places in Chicago! Pizza is always superb, salads are always fresh, staff is very attentive (especially when I stop by at 1am to pick up a few slices!) and the restaurant is spotless with very clean bathrooms. 👍❤️😊
Gluten free deep dish pizza was gorgeous <3 so thankful!
Best selections of gluten free items!

Great place! The service was super friendly, and they had some of the best gluten free pizza we've had. It was quiet and relaxing even on Friday evening. Makes a nice walk after a Cubs game. Definitely recommend.
My favorite thin crust pizza.
The perfect gluten free pizza EVER!

This place is always nice and cares for their customers well. They have enjoyable gluten free options for each style of pizza, and gluten free bread upon request for an appetizer, so that you're not left out at the table. Always satisfied here, even when I come in late at night.
Fresh pizza and good prices
